1. "Braveheart" (2005) - This epic historical drama directed by Mel Gibson is based on a novel written by William Wallace Bratton. The story takes place during the 13th century Scottish Wars of Independence and in the years immediately following the Battle of Bannock Bridge, which was one of the most significant battles ever fought by the British military and the French army. The film stars Mel Gibson as William Wallace, Sophie Marceau as Mary of Scotland, Robert Redford as Johnnie MacKenzie, Patrick McGoohan as Captain MacKenzie, Brian Dennehy as General Edward Butler, and Michael Jai White as Private Corporal Thomas "Red" Anderson. The film received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike upon its release in 2005. The film's popularity has since led to the production of a sequel film titled "Braveheart: Beyond the Call" (2014) by the same director Mel Gibson. The sequel film titled "Braveheart: Beyond the Call" (2014) is based on the novel written by William Wallace Bratton. The film is set during and after the American Civil War. The story revolves around Scarlett O'Hara, who becomes a wealthy and influential businesswoman in post-war America. However, her wealth comes at a great cost to Scarlett's personal life and relationships with others.

"Gone with the Wind" is a classic film that has stood the test of time and remains one of the most beloved and critically acclaimed films ever made.
